  • API Documentation

API Documentation¶

cord.client provides a simple Python client that allows you to query project resources through the Cord API.

Here is a simple example for instantiating the client for a project and obtaining project info:

class cord.client.CordClient(querier, config)¶

Cord client. Allows you to query db items associated with a project (e.g. label rows, datasets).

static initialise(resource_id=None, api_key=None, domain=None)¶

Create and initialize a Cord client from a resource EntityId and API key.

Parameters

  • resource_id (Optional[str]) –

    either of - A project EntityId string.

    If None, uses the CORD_PROJECT_ID environment variable.

    • A dataset EntityId string. If None, uses the CORD_DATASET_ID environment variable.

  • api_key (Optional[str]) – An API key. If None, uses the CORD_API_KEY environment variable.

  • domain (Optional[str]) – The cord api-server domain. If None, the CORD_DOMAIN is used

Returns

A Cord client instance.

Return type

CordClient

static initialise_with_config(config)¶

Create and initialize a Cord client from a Cord config instance.

Parameters

config (Config) – A Cord config instance.

Returns

A Cord client instance.

Return type

CordClient

class cord.client.CordClientDataset(querier, config)¶
add_private_data_to_dataset(integration_id, private_files, ignore_errors=False)¶

Append data hosted on private clouds to existing dataset

Parameters

  • integration_id (str) – str EntityId of the cloud integration to be used when accessing those files

  • private_files (Union[str, Dict, Path, TextIO]) – A str path or Path object to a json file, json str or python dictionary of the files you wish to add

  • ignore_errors (bool) – bool, optional Ignore individual errors when trying to access the specified files

create_image_group(file_paths, max_workers=None)¶

Create an image group in Cord storage.

Parameters

  • self – Cord client object.

  • file_paths (Iterable[str]) – a list of paths to images, e.g. [‘/home/user/data/img1.png’, ‘/home/user/data/img2.png’]

  • max_workers (Optional[int]) – Number of workers for parallel image upload. If set to None, this will be the number of CPU cores available on the machine.

Returns

Bool.

Raises

UploadOperationNotSupportedError – If trying to upload to external datasets (e.g. S3/GPC/Azure)

delete_data(data_hashes)¶

Delete a video/image group from a dataset.

Parameters

  • self – Cord client object.

  • data_hashes (List[str]) – list of hash of the videos/image_groups you’d like to delete, all should belong to the same dataset

delete_image_group(data_hash)¶

Create an image group in Cord storage.

Parameters

  • self – Cord client object.

  • data_hash (str) – the hash of the image group you’d like to delete

get_dataset()¶

Retrieve dataset info (pointers to data, labels).

Parameters

self – Cord client object.

Returns

A dataset record instance.

Return type

Dataset

Raises

  • AuthorisationError – If the dataset API key is invalid.

  • ResourceNotFoundError – If no dataset exists by the specified dataset EntityId.

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while retrieving the dataset.

re_encode_data(data_hashes)¶

Lanches a async task that can re-encode a list of videos.

Parameters

  • self – Cord client object.

  • data_hashes (List[str]) – list of hash of the videos you’d like to re_encode, all should belong to the same dataset

Returns

EntityId(integer) of the async task launched.

re_encode_data_status(job_id)¶

Returns the status of an existing async task which is aimed at re-encoding videos.

Parameters

  • self – Cord client object.

  • job_id (int) – id of the async task that was launched to re-encode the videos

Returns

Object containing the status of the task, along with info about the new encoded videos

in case the task has been completed

Return type

ReEncodeVideoTask

run_ocr(image_group_id)¶

Returns an optical character recognition result for a given image group :type image_group_id: str :param image_group_id: the id of the image group in this dataset to run OCR on

Return type

List[ImageGroupOCR]

Returns

Returns a list of ImageGroupOCR objects representing the text and corresponding coordinates found in each frame of the image group

upload_video(file_path)¶

Upload video to Cord storage.

Parameters

  • self – Cord client object.

  • file_path (str) – path to video e.g. ‘/home/user/data/video.mp4’

Returns

Bool.

Raises

UploadOperationNotSupportedError – If trying to upload to external datasets (e.g. S3/GPC/Azure)

class cord.client.CordClientProject(querier, config)¶
add_classification(name, classification_type, required, options=None)¶
Parameters

  • name (str) – the name of the classification

  • classification_type (ClassificationType) – the classification type (RADIO, TEXT or CHECKLIST)

  • required (whether this classification is required by the annotator) –

  • options (Optional[Iterable[str]]) – the list of options for the classification (to be set to None for texts)

Returns

If the project API key is invalid. AuthorisationError: If access to the specified resource is restricted. UnknownError: If an error occurs while add te classification to the project ontology OperationNotAllowed: If the operation is not allowed by the API key. ValueError: If invalid arguments are supplied in the function call

Return type

AuthenticationError

add_datasets(dataset_hashes)¶

Add a dataset to a project

Parameters

dataset_hashes (List[str]) – List of dataset hashes of the datasets to be added

Returns

Bool.

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • ResourceNotFoundError – If one or more datasets don’t exist by the specified dataset_hashes.

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while adding the datasets to the project.

  • OperationNotAllowed – If the write operation is not allowed by the API key.

add_object(name, shape)¶

Add object to an ontology :type name: str :param name: the name of the object :type shape: ObjectShape :param shape: the shape of the object (BOUNDING_BOX, POLYGON or KEY_POINT)

Return type

bool

Returns

bool

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while add te object to the project ontology

  • OperationNotAllowed – If the operation is not allowed by the API key.

  • ValueError – If invalid arguments are supplied in the function call

add_users(user_emails, user_role)¶

Add users to project

Parameters

  • user_emails (List[str]) – list of user emails to be added

  • user_role (ProjectUserRole) – the user role to assign to all users

Return type

List[ProjectUser]

Returns

ProjectUser

Raises

  • AuthorisationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • ResourceNotFoundError – If no project exists by the specified project EntityId.

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while adding the users to the project

copy_project(copy_datasets=False, copy_collaborators=False, copy_models=False)¶

Copy the current project into a new one with copied contents including settings, datasets and users. Labels and models are optional :param copy_datasets: if True, the datasets of the existing project are copied over, and new

tasks are created from those datasets

Parameters

  • copy_collaborators – if True, all users of the existing project are copied over with their current roles. If label and/or annotator reviewer mapping is set, this will also be copied over

  • copy_models – currently if True, all models with their training information will be copied into the new project

Returns

the EntityId of the newly created project

Raises

  • AuthorisationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • ResourceNotFoundError – If no project exists by the specified project EntityId.

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while copying the project.

create_label_row(uid)¶

Create a label row (for data in a project not previously been labeled).

Parameters

uid – the data_hash (uid) of the data unit being labeled. Available in client.get_project().get(‘label_rows’) where label_status is NOT_LABELLED.

Returns

A label row instance.

Return type

LabelRow

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while saving the label.

  • OperationNotAllowed – If the write operation is not allowed by the API key.

  • AnswerDictionaryError – If an object or classification instance is missing in answer dictionaries.

  • CorruptedLabelError – If a blurb is corrupted (e.g. if the frame labels have more frames than the video).

  • ResourceExistsError – If a label row already exists for this project data. Avoids overriding existing work.

create_model_row(title=None, description=None, features=None, model=None)¶

Create a model row.

Parameters

  • title – Model title.

  • description – Model description.

  • features – List of feature feature uid’s (hashes) to be included in the model.

  • model – Model (resnet18, resnet34, resnet50, resnet101, resnet152, vgg16, vgg19, yolov5, faster_rcnn, mask_rcnn).

Returns

A model_hash (uid) string.

Return type

ModelRow

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • ModelFeaturesInconsistentError – If a feature type is different than what is supported by the model (e.g. if creating a classification model using a bounding box).

fitted_bounding_boxes(frames, video)¶
Parameters

  • frames (dict) –

    Labels for frames to be fitted. Frames are consumed in the form:

    ”frame”: {
    “objects”: [
    {

    “objectHash”: object_uid, “featureHash”: feature_uid (from editor ontology), “polygon”: {

    ”0”: {

    “x”: x1, “y”: y1,

    }, “1”: {

    ”x”: x2, “y”: y2,

    }, “2” {

    ”x”: x3, “y”: y3,

    }, …,

    }

    }, {

    …

    }

    ]

    }, “frame”: {

    …,

    }

  • video (dict) –

    Metadata of the video for which bounding box fitting needs to be run

    {

    “width” : w, “height” : h,

    }

Returns

Full set of filled frames including fitted objects.

Return type

Fitting results

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while running interpolation.

get_data(data_hash, get_signed_url=False)¶

Retrieve information about a video or image group.

Params:

data_hash: The uid of the data object get_signed_url: Optionally return signed URLs for timed public access to that resource

(default False)

Return type

Tuple[Optional[Video], Optional[List[Image]]]

Returns

A consisting of the video (if it exists) and a list of individual images (if they exist)

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while retrieving the object.

get_label_row(uid, get_signed_url=True)¶

Retrieve label row.

Parameters

  • uid (str) – A label_hash (uid) string.

  • get_signed_url (bool) – By default the operation returns a signed URL for the underlying data asset. This can be

  • off (expensive so it can optionally be turned) –

Returns

A label row instance.

Return type

LabelRow

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • ResourceNotFoundError – If no label exists by the specified label_hash (uid).

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while retrieving the label.

  • OperationNotAllowed – If the read operation is not allowed by the API key.

get_project()¶

Retrieve project info (pointers to data, labels).

Parameters

self – Cord client object.

Returns

A project record instance.

Return type

Project

Raises

  • AuthorisationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • ResourceNotFoundError – If no project exists by the specified project EntityId.

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while retrieving the project.

model_delete(uid)¶

Delete a model created on the platform.

Parameters

uid (str) – A model_hash (uid) string.

Return type

bool

Returns

bool

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • ResourceNotFoundError – If no model exists by the specified model_hash (uid).

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs during training.

model_inference(uid, file_paths=None, base64_strings=None, conf_thresh=0.6, iou_thresh=0.3, device='cuda', detection_frame_range=None, allocation_enabled=False)¶

Run inference with model trained on the platform.

Parameters

  • uid – A model_iteration_hash (uid) string.

  • file_paths – List of local file paths to image(s) or video(s) - if running inference on files.

  • base64_strings – List of base 64 strings of image(s) or video(s) - if running inference on base64 strings.

  • conf_thresh – Confidence threshold (default 0.6).

  • iou_thresh – Intersection over union threshold (default 0.3).

  • device – Device (CPU or CUDA, default is CUDA).

  • detection_frame_range – Detection frame range (for videos).

  • allocation_enabled – Object UID allocation (tracking) enabled (disabled by default).

Returns

A dict of inference results.

Return type

Inference results

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • ResourceNotFoundError – If no model exists by the specified model_iteration_hash (uid).

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while running inference.

  • FileTypeNotSupportedError – If the file type is not supported for inference (has to be an image or video)

  • DetectionRangeInvalidError – If a detection range is invalid for video inference

model_train(uid, label_rows=None, epochs=None, batch_size=24, weights=None, device='cuda')¶

Train a model created on the platform.

Parameters

  • uid – A model_hash (uid) string.

  • label_rows – List of label row uid’s (hashes) for training.

  • epochs – Number of passes through training dataset.

  • batch_size – Number of training examples utilized in one iteration.

  • weights – Model weights.

  • device – Device (CPU or CUDA, default is CUDA).

Returns

A model iteration object.

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • ModelWeightsInconsistentError – If the passed model weights are incompatible with the selected model.

  • ResourceNotFoundError – If no model exists by the specified model_hash (uid).

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs during training.

object_interpolation(key_frames, objects_to_interpolate)¶

Run object interpolation algorithm on project labels (requires an editor ontology and feature uid’s).

Interpolation is supported for bounding box, polygon, and keypoint.

Parameters

  • key_frames –

    Labels for frames to be interpolated. Key frames are consumed in the form:

    ”frame”: {
    “objects”: [
    {

    “objectHash”: object_uid, “featureHash”: feature_uid (from editor ontology), “polygon”: {

    ”0”: {

    “x”: x1, “y”: y1,

    }, “1”: {

    ”x”: x2, “y”: y2,

    }, “2” {

    ”x”: x3, “y”: y3,

    }, …,

    }

    }, {

    …

    }

    ]

    }, “frame”: {

    …,

    }

  • objects_to_interpolate – List of object uid’s (hashes) of objects to interpolate.

Returns

Full set of filled frames including interpolated objects.

Return type

Interpolation results

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while running interpolation.

remove_datasets(dataset_hashes)¶

Remove datasets from project

Parameters

dataset_hashes (List[str]) – List of dataset hashes of the datasets to be removed

Returns

Bool.

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • ResourceNotFoundError – If no dataset exists by the specified dataset_hash (uid).

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while removing the datasets from the project.

  • OperationNotAllowed – If the operation is not allowed by the API key.

save_label_row(uid, label)¶

Save existing label row.

If you have a series of frame labels and have not updated answer dictionaries, call the construct_answer_dictionaries utilities function to do so prior to saving labels.

Parameters

  • uid – A label_hash (uid) string.

  • label – A label row instance.

Returns

Bool.

Raises

  • AuthenticationError – If the project API key is invalid.

  • AuthorisationError – If access to the specified resource is restricted.

  • ResourceNotFoundError – If no label exists by the specified label_hash (uid).

  • UnknownError – If an error occurs while saving the label.

  • OperationNotAllowed – If the write operation is not allowed by the API key.

  • AnswerDictionaryError – If an object or classification instance is missing in answer dictionaries.

  • CorruptedLabelError – If a blurb is corrupted (e.g. if the frame labels have more frames than the video).

class cord.configs.BaseConfig(endpoint)¶
class cord.configs.Config(resource_id=None, api_key=None, web_file_path=None, domain=None, websocket_endpoint='wss://message-api.cord.tech/websocket')¶

Config defining endpoint, project id, API key, and timeouts.

class cord.configs.CordConfig(resource_id=None, api_key=None, domain='https://api.cord.tech')¶
class cord.configs.UserConfig(private_key, domain='https://api.cord.tech')¶
exception cord.exceptions.AnswerDictionaryError(message)¶

Exception thrown when answer dictionaries are incomplete. Occurs when an object or classification is missing.

exception cord.exceptions.AuthenticationError(message)¶

Exception thrown when API key fails authentication.

exception cord.exceptions.AuthorisationError(message)¶

Exception thrown when access is unauthorised. (E.g. access to a data asset or method).

exception cord.exceptions.CordException(message)¶

Base class for all exceptions.

exception cord.exceptions.CorruptedLabelError(message)¶

Exception thrown when a label is corrupted. (E.g. the frame labels have more frames than the video).

exception cord.exceptions.DetectionRangeInvalidError(message)¶

Exception thrown when a detection range is invalid. (E.g. negative or higher than num frames in video).

exception cord.exceptions.FeatureDoesNotExistError(message)¶

If a feature uid does not exist in a given project ontology.

exception cord.exceptions.FileTypeNotSupportedError(message)¶

Exception thrown when a file type is not supported. Supported file types are: image/jpeg, image/png, video/webm, video/mp4.

exception cord.exceptions.InitialisationError(message)¶

Exception thrown when API key fails to initialise.

exception cord.exceptions.InvalidAlgorithmError(message)¶

Exception thrown when invalid labeling algorithm name is sent.

exception cord.exceptions.MethodNotAllowedError(message)¶

Exception thrown when HTTP method is not allowed.

exception cord.exceptions.ModelFeaturesInconsistentError(message)¶

If a feature type is different than what is supported by the model (e.g. if creating a classification model using a bounding box).

exception cord.exceptions.ModelWeightsInconsistentError(message)¶

Exception thrown when an attempted model training iteration has a different type of weights than what is recorded (i.e. if type of model_hash (uid) is faster_rcnn, but is attempted trained with yolov5 weights).

exception cord.exceptions.OperationNotAllowed(message)¶

Exception thrown when a read/write operation is not allowed. The API key blocks the operation.

exception cord.exceptions.RequestException(message)¶

Ambiguous exception while handling request.

exception cord.exceptions.ResourceExistsError(message)¶

Exception thrown when trying to re-create a resource. Avoids overriding existing work.

exception cord.exceptions.ResourceNotFoundError(message)¶

Exception thrown when a requested resource is not found. (E.g. label, data asset).

exception cord.exceptions.TimeOutError(message)¶

Exception thrown when a request times out.

exception cord.exceptions.UnknownException(message)¶

Unknown error.

exception cord.exceptions.UploadOperationNotSupportedError(message)¶

Exception thrown when trying to upload a video/image group to non-Cord storage dataset

class cord.user_client.CordUserClient(user_config, querier)¶
create_project_from_cvat(import_method, dataset_name, review_mode=ReviewMode.LABELLED, max_workers=None)¶
Export your CVAT project with the “CVAT for images 1.1” option and use this function to import

your images and annotations into cord. Ensure that during you have the “Save images” checkbox enabled when exporting from CVAT.

Parameters

  • import_method (LocalImport) – The chosen import method. See the ImportMethod class for details.

  • dataset_name (str) – The name of the dataset that will be created.

  • review_mode (ReviewMode) –

    Set how much interaction is needed from the labeler and from the reviewer for the CVAT labels.

    See the ReviewMode documentation for more details.

  • max_workers (Optional[int]) – Number of workers for parallel image upload. If set to None, this will be the number of CPU cores available on the machine.

Returns

If the project was successfully imported. CvatImporterError: If the project could not be imported.

Return type

CvatImporterSuccess

Raises

ValueError – If the CVAT directory has an invalid format.

class cord.utilities.client_utilities.APIKeyScopes(value)¶

An enumeration.

class cord.utilities.client_utilities.CvatImporterError(dataset_hash, issues)¶
class cord.utilities.client_utilities.CvatImporterSuccess(project_hash, dataset_hash, issues)¶
cord.utilities.client_utilities.ImportMethod¶

Using images/videos in cloud storage as an alternative import method will be supported in the future.

class cord.utilities.client_utilities.Issue(issue_type, instances)¶

For each issue_type there may be multiple occurrences which are documented in the instances. The instances list can provide additional information on how the issue was encountered. If there is no additional information available, the instances list will be empty.

class cord.utilities.client_utilities.Issues(errors, warnings, infos)¶

Any issues that came up during importing a project. These usually come from incompatibilities between data saved on different platforms.

Examples

You can use the prettyprinter package to inspect this dataclass if you’re using Python 3.9 or older

>>> install prettyprinter as pp
>>> pp.install_extras()
>>>
>>> issues = ... # some code which returns this object
>>> pp.pprint(issues)
class cord.utilities.client_utilities.LocalImport(file_path)¶

file_path: Supply the path of the exported folder which contains the images and annotations.xml file. Make sure to select “Save images” when exporting your CVAT Task or Project.
